dialogue.String: There is an oddly shaped depression in the center of the grate.The grate does not seem to be a door, as it is one with the walls around it.1�
The 3���� begins to glow.1�
Insert the 3����?Yes.No.1�
I've got a score to settle with Eald'narche. It's time to put an end to that midget's plan!1�
�The amount of impurities inside the furnace is gradually decreasing.�

�This area is currently affected by the Super Kupower: �� �[/Thrifty Transit/Martial Master/Blood of the Vampyr/Treasure Hound/Artisan's Advantage/Myriad Mystery Boxes/Dilatory Digestion/Boundary Buster/Bountiful Bazaar/Swift Shoes/Crystal Caboodle]��!This area is currently affected by the Super Kupower: �� [/Thrifty Transit/Martial Master/Blood of the Vampyr/Treasure Hound/Artisan's Advantage/Myriad Mystery Boxes/Dilatory Digestion/Boundary Buster/Bountiful Bazaar/Swift Shoes/Crystal Caboodle]��!This area is currently affected by the Super Kupower: �� [/Thrifty Transit/Martial Master/Blood of the Vampyr/Treasure Hound/Artisan's Advantage/Myriad Mystery Boxes/Dilatory Digestion/Boundary Buster/Bountiful Bazaar/Swift Shoes/Crystal Caboodle]��!�
So that's how it works...Well, there's no turning back now. Let's go, Zeid. You too,  .1�
It seems as if we cannot continue on any further.1�
What's going on? Does this mean our power was not accepted by the crystal?1�
Long have I awaited thine arrival...1�
Thou hast come here to try and stop Eald'narche--to keep him from opening the Gate of the Gods...1�
I am Yve'noile, a servant of the Dawn Goddess. I watch over the path leading to the gate.1�
All the Zilart, including Eald'narche, are still bound by our cursed past.1�
As thou already know, his plan began ten thousand years ago when he came into contact with the five crystals that rest beneath the surface of Vana'diel. The true crystals...1�
However, during the Meltdown, the energy of these smaller crystals was simultaneously released and spread to the far reaches of Vana'diel.1�

Over centuries, that energy accumulated inside the bodies of the living beings on this planet, causing them to crystallize. Thus, they took the form of the crystals that are found throughout Vana'diel.1�
Mortals are an incomplete species. When Eald'narche's quest for Paradise was thwarted, life on this planet lost its perfection.1�
Particularly, thine inability to communicate with the others of thy race casts a shadow over thy development.1�
This inability became increasingly evident after the Meltdown divided thee into the five races.1�

The arrogance of the Elvaan, the envy of the Mithra, the cowardice of the Tarutaru, the apathy of the Humes, the rage of the Galka... These are the traits thou must carry with thee as thou make thy journeys through life.1�
However, unlike the tales thy legends tell, these traits are not some ancient curse. They are merely an aftereffect of the energy released during the Meltdown.1�
One can understand why Eald'narche would aspire for perfection...1�
However, one can see why others would acknowledge the benefits of imperfection.1�
I beg of thee. Release Eald'narche, and what remains of the Zilart consciousness, from the crystal's binds.I pray for thy safe journey. 1�
May the Goddess of the Dawn protect thee in Her mercy...1�
But as one bright star shines through the clouds at night...1�
And as one song rings clear above the roar of beasts...1�
We hold to one hope in these darkest of times.1�
�The complete set of mog tablets has been restored to Ru'Lude Gardens!The ancient magic of King Kupofried permeates the air to instill adventurers in this area with its Super Kupowers!�
Use the transporting device?Yes.Not yet.1�
Use the transporting device?Yes.Not yet.1�
Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, �[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.1�
Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?1�
I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.1�
Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.1�

What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.The Gate of the Gods(pt.1).The Gate of the Gods(pt.2).Born of Her Nightmares.Death and Rebirth.Emissaries of God.Beneath a Blood-red Sky.Meanwhile, Back on Abyssea.Exploring the Ruins(pt.1).Exploring the Ruins(pt.2).Exploring the Ruins(pt.3).Exploring the Ruins(pt.4).Exploring the Ruins(pt.5).Exploring the Ruins(pt.6).Exploring the Ruins(pt.7).Become Something More(pt.1).Become Something More(pt.2).1�
Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.1�
Emeline!Can you hear me!?1�
What--? Where... Where am I...?�
Aldo...? Is that you...?1�
Emeline...could it truly be?After all these years...1�
Aldo...My...brother...1�
No!Emeline!!!�
No...! Where are they taking me!? Aldo, help me!�
(Curses!No...I won't let them take you from me again!)1�
It's no use, Uncle...where she is now, no words can reach her.Mother's dreaming, you see.1�
Lost in a waking dream...just like me.1�
Deep in slumber, freed from the restraints of my physical body...It is here that the voice of the Seed Crystal speaks to me.1�
I awaken, only to remember nothing.1�
It's the same for mother, you see.Only in her dreams does she remember a past too frightening, too painful to face with waking eyes.1�
Only in her dreams does she remember you, Uncle Aldo.1�
Knowing this, would you open her eyes to the light of the world once more?1�
The choice belongs to you alone, Uncle.1�
And the power to save this world from destruction is yours,  .1�

You, and all living beings on Vana'diel.It is your will to live--your deep love for the world you call home--that is the key.Only you can instill the antiphon with the strength to counteract the echo...1�
So what will your choice be, Uncle Aldo?  ?1�
Will you silence the echo to save this world from destruction?Even knowing it would mean death for the sister you knew, will you do what must be done?1�
If you have the courage to answer, make way for the Stellar Fulcrum at the peak of Delkfutt's Tower.1�
We'll be waiting for you there.1�
Perhaps...we're all just living inside the crystal's dream.1�
(Emeline...)�
Arrrg,  . Mighty good o' ye t' oblige me invite t' this out-o'-the-way place, matey.1�
Y'see, we be needin' the...errr, somethin' 'r whats hereabouts. Magenta field or some magnetic feel or some such. The sciency stuff be way off me maps. Here be monsters, yarrr.1�
Last we spoke--last I prrrattled, more like--I ga'e ye me solemn word I'd cork up me ramblin'.An' a pirate's word be as good as the gold he hoards. Arrrg.1�
So it oughta please ye t' know someone else'll do most o' the talkin' today.1�
Who be the special guest, ye ask? Why, none other'n the lil' mistress ye'd shown so much interrrest in, matey.As it happens, the feelin' be mutual, an' she been askin' after ye too.1�
Out ye come now, lil' missy.  's here an' awaitin' yer pleasurrre.1�
My gratitude for this favor, Gilgamesh.1�
No call fer thanks, now. Hearin' out the whims o' peppy young lasses be as much a hobby o' mine as borin' hapless adventurers t' tears with me inane blatherin'. Arrrg.1�
Greetings,  . My name is Esha'ntarl.Before I begin, please accept my apologies for having to appear before you in this unseemly state.1�

Unlike a chosen few, I do not possess the power to traverse worlds. For this reason, I requested that our meeting take place within the Hall of the Gods, that we might harness the energy that permeates these sacred grounds.1�
Never before had a partial dimensional crossing such as this been attempted.I must express my relief that the experiment is a success, else we might never have had the opportunity to speak.1�
Judging by your expression, I gather we are already acquainted in your world.It would seem fate has had a hand in bringing us together once more.1�
Your wary expression tells me you have yet to cross paths with my counterpart in Vana'diel.1�
Nevertheless, fate has now deemed it fit that we meet.1�
The world of mortals--the collective lives of men--is as a great river, formed of innumerable tributaries converging upon a single, torrential flow.1�
And you,  , are as a single leaf borne on the current...a current that brings together fellow drifters as often as it parts them.1�
Be it distant future or forgotten past, such is your destiny as is writ in the stars.1�
A destiny you share with your counterpart in Abyssea...1�
Well do I know of your valor,  , the selfless actions you have taken on our world's behalf.To you I would entrust the truth of Abyssea, a secret I have kept closely guarded for the longest time.1�
The cataclysm that has ravaged the land--it is a thing spawned from the will of Promathia, a primeval divinity who has stirred to wakefulness with the coming of His worldly avatar.1�
Eh? A man-god? I gone me entirrre life thinkin' there be jus' the Goddess. Now ye say there also be a ��He��?1�
Correct. Also known as the Twilight God, Promathia has existed alongside the Dawn Goddess Altana since the beginning of time.1�
The statue erected within this hall, standing opposed to that of the Goddess, is none other than His likeness.1�
Much knowledge pertaining to Promathia's existence has long lain hidden from the prying eyes of mortals.1�
Indeed, that the world was born from the tragedy that befell the two divinities is known only to a select few.1�
Arrrg, this careerrr pirate ain't sure he follows...1�
It was the Age of Gods. The Lord of Chaos, Promathia, desired and succumbed to complete death.1�
In Her grief, Altana bestowed upon the fallen deity the light of the true crystal, and in so doing gave birth to life.Thus was mankind created.1�
The true crystal, drained of its power, shattered into five parts.Bereft of its blessed light, the realm of gods was reduced into the world of mortals, Abyssea.1�
Yet the will of the gods persisted, graven deep within mankind. And with it, the dream that the world be returned to its former state...that Paradise, the realm of gods, be restored.1�
So too did the desire for death live on unfading, a smoldering darkness--an Emptiness--within the souls of mortals.1�
Blimey...1�

I won't lie t' ye, missy. The bulk o' yer tale flew right over me head like a scrrreechin' gull.I think I grasp the meat o' it, though. This Proma...somethin'-or-other be the reason behind Abyssea's wretched state, aye?1�
But what be so terrible 'bout a dead deity bein' restored to life? Wouldn't a livin' god serve better'n a stiff one?1�
That is not the case, I fear, for it was the Twilight God's death that brought forth mankind. His resurrection would therefore spell our demise.1�
By Leviathan's whiskers!1�

The disfiguring metamorphosis of the land is a manifestation of lives being reclaimed by Promathia.Drained of its power for eons, the true crystal, too, has begun to regain its erstwhile form and light.1�
The wheels of the world's rebirth have been set in motion.1�
Arrrg, so this be the culprit behind the reddenin' sky an' the earthquakes, among a host o' other things...1�
Correct. The lattice-shaped breakdown of the land is proof positive of this reversion.1�
. Gilgamesh.I must beg for your forgiveness.1�
That this event would come to pass had been foretold since ancient times.It was my intent to be fully prepared when the day came--to be ready to avert disaster.1�
But in the end, I was powerless before the unyielding avalanche of fate.1�
That the people now suffer so is due to my impotence. The blame lies with me.1�
What will you say?That's not true!...1�
Arrrg, I wholeheartedly second  .There be no call fer beatin' yerself up on this, lass.1�
Arrrg, there be no call fer beatin' yerself up on this, lass.Bearin' the burden o' this terrible knowledge, ye did what ye could.1�
The rest o' us, on the other hand, we been blissful in our ignorance all our lives, clueless 'bout our origin.1�
By me measure, things wouldn't of turned out so pretty if ye hadn't done the drudgery belowdecks.1�
Ye can be proud o' yer efforts, lil' missy.1�
Abyssea might never be her scenic old self again, but we're still standin' here, alive an' kickin'.The world's rebirth's begun, there be no denyin' that, but it ain't over either.1�

The situation ain't improvin' much, true, but neither has it been deterioratin'.If I ain't mistaken, there be some kind o' anchor keepin' this ship from smashin' into the jagged rocks o' apocalypse.1�
What do you mean?1�
I'd stake me one good peeper them Champions o' Abyssea had somethin' t' do with it.1�
Might be they went an' met their maker--an' in more ways'n one, heh--but that don't mean their efforts were fer naught.1�
So where the hell did they go, an' what the devil did they do? Now I gots a nose fer treasure an' an eye fer booty, an' they're sayin' if we follow the trail we jus' might hit gold.1�
Gilgamesh...1�
Now, I be jus' a simple sailor, but I pride meself on bein' a good judge o' folk.1�
An' I judge ye well as well gets, lil' missy.I be on this ship with ye t' the bloody end, whether it takes us t' treasures untold, or Davy Jones's locker.1�
An' I know   shares the same sentiments.Ain't that right, matey?1�
Do you have faith in Esha'ntarl?Aye, with all me heart!...Huh?1�
Harharhar! That be the spirit, matey!Fer one not even o' our world, ye sure be dependable!1�
Crikey, matey! Haven't ye got eyes t' read between the lines?The lil' missy, she be in dire need o' cheer, now!1�
Thank you, Gilgamesh,  .It has done my spirit well to have spoken with the two of you.1�
Your theory in particular, Gilgamesh, bears further investigation.I, too, shall do what I can on this quarter.1�
For now, I take my leave of you. Fare you well.1�
...An' there ye have it.If I find out anythin', ye'll be the first t' know, matey. Through Joachim, o' course.1�
I mus' say, all o' this gets me buccaneer's blood pumpin'.1�
After all, it ain't everyday ye get t' stick it t' the man!Well, a god in this case...an' one who chooses death, t' boot.1�
There be no guarantees t' be had that a happy endin' awaits us.But it gives me heart,  , knowin' ye're fightin' on our side.1�
Till next time, promise me ye won't go gettin' yerself killed.1�

�A mog tablet has been discovered in  �[West Ronfaure/East Ronfaure/the La Theine Plateau/the Valkurm Dunes/Jugner Forest/the Batallia Downs/North Gustaberg/South Gustaberg/the Konschtat Highlands/the Pashhow Marshlands/the Rolanberry Fields/Beaucedine Glacier/Xarcabard/West Sarutabaruta/East Sarutabaruta/the Tahrongi Canyon/the Buburimu Peninsula/the Meriphataud Mountains/the Sauromugue Champaign/Qufim Island/Behemoth's Dominion/Cape Teriggan/the Eastern Altepa Desert/the Sanctuary of Zi'Tah/Ro'Maeve/the Yuhtunga Jungle/the Yhoator Jungle/the Western Altepa Desert/the Valley of Sorrows]!�
You are  , correct?1�
Permit me to introduce myself. I am Esha'ntarl, representative of Archduke Kam'lanaut of the Grand Duchy of Jeuno.1�
Ah, but your face belies your surprise at seeing one such as me here. Despite my position, I am given free reign to go where I please.1�
I heard tell of a young woman struggling to save the world from oblivion together with her master...an adventurer. You.1�
I desired but to lay my own two eyes on �[his/her] visage.1�
I had an inkling you would be here.1�
You must be taken aback to be reunited with me here, of all places.1�
To think we had prevented the world from ending one way, only to find out it would end another...1�
And Iroha? Is she not with you?1�
I understand you have no reason to place your trust in me, but know this--I wish only to shelter this world from harm.1�
Surely you can sense that my words ring true.1�
Please. Apprise me of what you have learned thus far.1�
Please. Apprise me of what you have learned thus far.1�
So Iroha expired and has yet to return to this mortal coil.1�
Revival is in the realm of the gods, and if she has not yet returned, it may be because they do not permit it.1�
Only the ancients--the Zilart--possess the means by which to open these gates.1�
I shall unbar the way.1�
Ah, but you are already in possession of 6����. I should have expected no less.1�
Lady Yve'noile serves the Goddess of the Dawn in all her incarnations and is the custodian of the Gate by which she can be reached.1�
Lady Esha'ntarl, thy presence doth come as a surprise. To think one such as thyself would come posing questions for me.1�
A young woman has traversed time itself to speak with  .1�
She claimed that an existence which some call the Void--and others call the Cloud of Darkness--has come to claim Vana'diel.1�
The Cloud of Darkness, you say...1�
Alas, I can confess to hearing that name only once before in my lifetime.1�
The prophecies say that the Cloud of Darkness is fated to descend upon this land once the five pieces of the mothercrystal have turned to dust.1�
Were the pieces to be made whole once more, it is perhaps possible to avoid this most gloomy of futures.1�
But that day itself will signal the end of Vana'diel.1�
Yet even the struggles of the vaunted warriors of light would mean naught against the coming purge.1�
Then pray tell--is there aught we can do?1�
If we cannot stop it while mortal...1�
...then we must walk the path of the gods.1�
You would have   become a god?1�
You mean �[he/she] must cast off the bonds of the Emptiness that shackle all who are born and destined to die?1�
Some would say you speak madness, but I cannot deny that if such a ritual succeeded...1�
I shall not lade my words with honey. The idea is so dangerous that failure can end only in death.1�
Yet shouldst thou choose to walk the path of thorns, I shall help clear the way. For only one such as thou can make the journey.1�
